body.p: To Gov Magoffin Governor of Kentucky
We would represent to your Excellency the following to be a true statement:

Wash Ebolling of Franklin County was tried before his Honor Geo W Gwin a Justice of the Peace for Franklin County on the 21st May 1862 for a misdemeanor -- Judgment was rendered against him for $30, 15 days imprisonment and costs of proceeding -- not being able to pay said fine, we recommend him to your Excellency's Clemency -- on the conditions following which he has accepted and executed= That he pay the costs and enters into the bond for good behaviour until next Court Circuit Court for Franklin County, which Court will be holden in the city of Frankfort 4th Monday of June 1862 --

Geo. W. Gwin J. P. F. C.
Eugene P. Moore Atty F. C.

Remitted as to all except the costs in them
B. M.

Franklin J P.
Wash Ebling
$30
15 days Impt } Mis.
Iss May 29th 1862
